page.title: 06WARWICK UNIVERSITY
page.content: The University of Warwick was built on 400 of land. The site has doubled in size. In 1965 the first undergraduates were admitted. First we went to the Sports' Hall where we saw students playing all different kinds of sports like basketball, tennis, badminton and rock-climbing etc. The building has got an indoor heated swimming pool. One half of the pool was roped off because local schoolchildren were practising for a Gala. The other half was being used by students. There are 4 squash courts. There is an Arts Centre, open to the public, where concerts,plays and films are shown. In the public areas are examples of modern art. A new cinema is being built. Most buildings are of white-painted concrete and few of them are taller than 4 storeys.
